headline: ‘Magnets for crime’: How one Seattle politician’s views shifted on homeless encampments
author: Danny Westneat
sentences: Recently the freshman Seattle City Councilmember Andrew Lewis was listening to a discussion on the extreme rise in gun violence in the city, and some simple questions were raised that he realized he didn’t know concrete answers to.

(snip) Probably nobody on his committee would have guessed that homelessness and the encampments were a bigger associating factor with Seattle’s shooting epidemic than gang activity
Comments:
Signs of the woke waking up.
(snip) What Lewis found is that more than 18% of all shots-fired incidents in Seattle last year were associated with homelessness, according to police records.
(But of course they still only look at very, very expensive housing, rather than behavior and values.)
One of their princes admits that crime is associated with "homeless" camps.
Who’s doing the shooting, and where?
